summary: This is an email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of the Virgin Islands (USVI) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding the division of labor in investigating Jeffrey Epstein. The USVI office expresses interest in investigating potential sex trafficking offenses that occurred in the USVI, specifically mentioning an allegation involving Prince Andrew, and seeks cooperation and information sharing from SDNY.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation for alleged sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in press reports as allegedly having sex with a minor victim trafficked by Epstein in the USVI.

connections.description: Epstein is alleged to have trafficked a minor victim who was then caused to have sex with Prince Andrew, according to press reports referenced in the document.

events.title: USVI Office Inquiry into Epstein Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of the Virgin Islands contacts SDNY to express interest in investigating potential sex trafficking crimes by Epstein and his associates that occurred in the USVI, which may fall outside SDNY's venue or jurisdiction.

events.title: Allegation of Abuse Involving Prince Andrew
events.description: The document references recent press reports alleging a victim was trafficked by Epstein and caused to have sex with Prince Andrew while she was a minor, with some conduct occurring in the USVI.

locations: 5500 Veterans Drive, Suite 260, St. Thomas, VI 00802-6424
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) led the investigation into sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, while the U.S. Virgin Islands (USVI) office led the investigation into Epstein's financial dealings near the time of his death.

The USVI office is concerned that crimes occurring in the USVI might go unpunished due to jurisdictional divisions and seeks to investigate any such offenses, particularly those SDNY cannot prosecute.
The document specifically cites press reports alleging a victim was trafficked by Epstein and made to have sex with Prince Andrew while a minor, with some conduct occurring in the USVI.
The USVI office requests cooperation and information sharing from SDNY regarding evidence of sex trafficking in the USVI that SDNY may not be pursuing.
The correspondence highlights inter-district coordination challenges in a multi-jurisdictional investigation involving high-profile figures and sensitive allegations.
